programme.title: Kauboji
Kauboji
programme.desc: Kauboji: Directed by Tomislav Mrsic. With Sasa Anocic, Zivko Anocic, Matija Antolic, Hrvoje Barisic. Eight outsiders are trying to create a theater play while breaking every rule of theater craft." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt2994904/","name":"Kauboji","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjJiNTg5YmItMjI5Mi00MmY0LWFlZjgtY2UzODI5Y2IzYzU0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzAyMzY2NDk@._V1_.jpg","genre":["Comedy","Drama"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1088988/","name":"Sasa Anocic"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1927205/","name":"Zivko Anocic"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5888746/","name":"Matija Antolic"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2283941/","name":"Tomislav Mrsic"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0433957/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1088988/","name":"Sasa Anocic"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2283941/","name":"Tomislav Mrsic"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Cowboys","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi4153917209","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BM2YxNTA1ZjQtYzc1OC00NjNhLTkzOTMtNDJkMjgzNzJjZTlkXkEyXkFqcGdeQTNwaW5nZXN0._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BM2YxNTA1ZjQtYzc1OC00NjNhLTkzOTMtNDJkMjgzNzJjZTlkXkEyXkFqcGdeQTNwaW5nZXN0._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer 1"},"datePublished":"2013-10-10","description":"Eight outsiders are trying to create a theater play while breaking every rule of theater craft.","keywords":"theater","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2994904/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"info-480-509704"},"dateCreated":"2013-12-13","inLanguage":"English","name":"John Wayne is turning in his grave with laughter!","reviewBody":"Rating: 8,5/10 review by Vanja Runjic\n\nThe story of the movie Cowboys is not just a story of good and evil, as the movie heroes identify the main dramatic axis of the western as a genre, but also a story of high art and low populism - although some high-brow film critics would say that is basically the same thing. Cowboys are based on a hit theater show that was seen by well over 100.000 viewers (some say even 150.000), proving that an art experiment need not necessarily be abstract, hermetic and addressed to narrow elitist circles. However, one need not see the theater show to enjoy the movie. In fact, it might be quite refreshing to see it without preconceptions. A gloomy middle-aged theater director Sasha (Sasa Anocic) returns to his home town, even gloomier industrial province, where an old friend, the local mayor (Niksa Butijer) convinces him to put on a theater show with a group of amateurs. A group of weirdoes and bizarre looking types arrives for the audition, none of them having any acting or theater experience whatsoever, and the disillusioned director ends up taking them all. From the first shots we are aware of all the fullmonthy and other underdog clichés, but instead of seeing them as a potential flaw, surprisingly they turn out to be one of the best qualities of this movie. Considering that everything has already been said in film (and music) and it is not easy to be original, especially on such slippery ground as with popular comedy, I have to point out the work of the director and scriptwriter Tomislav Mrsic, acclaimed documentarist, who has managed to use all the character, situational and dramatic clichés in such a way that the viewer doesn't feel annoyed by the fact that they have all been seen. Which is a good feeling! The movie Cowboys is an ensemble comedy, and it's all about the roles they play – even if there were only two or three great actors, it would be a success. Mrsic was lucky in that regard, mostly thanks to the fact that he used the same cast as in the theater show. There is the dumb Domagoj (the incredible Zivko Anocic), who remains a mystery until the end: is he a complete idiot, mentally challenged, or both, or is he just pretending? Then, the friendly gypsy Miodrag (played by the equally great Rakan Rushaidat); the postman Javor, an annoying wannabe actor, busy bee and mama's boy played by Hrvoje Barisic, a pleasant surprise. I can only imagine how irritable he could get if directed by such masters of annoyance like Gervais, Merchant or Larry David, but Mrsic manages to keep him likable. That is the main forte and the charm of this movie – a feel good atmosphere, light humor, discreet pathos, free of any presumptuousness. Not to mention the grand finale. Comedy is a tricky business, especially when it aims to appeal to the masses. Anybody can make some drunken friends laugh, but big audiences are tough, and critics even tougher. Mrsic and Cowboys did it, and the fact that they reached their goal without over psychologizing the characters or overdramatizing and by using a bunch of commonplace devices, makes their triumph even greater","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1027,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7},"duration":"PT1H47M"}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 2994904, Title: Kauboji, --- Description: Kauboji: Directed by Tomislav Mrsic. With Sasa Anocic, Zivko Anocic, Matija Antolic, Hrvoje Barisic. Eight outsiders are trying to create a theater play while breaking every rule of theater craft." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt2994904/","name":"Kauboji","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjJiNTg5YmItMjI5Mi00MmY0LWFlZjgtY2UzODI5Y2IzYzU0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzAyMzY2NDk@._V1_.jpg","genre":["Comedy","Drama"],"actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1088988/","name":"Sasa Anocic","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1927205/","name":"Zivko Anocic","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5888746/","name":"Matija Antolic"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2283941/","name":"Tomislav Mrsic"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0433957/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1088988/","name":"Sasa Anocic","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2283941/","name":"Tomislav Mrsic"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Cowboys","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi4153917209","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BM2YxNTA1ZjQtYzc1OC00NjNhLTkzOTMtNDJkMjgzNzJjZTlkXkEyXkFqcGdeQTNwaW5nZXN0._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BM2YxNTA1ZjQtYzc1OC00NjNhLTkzOTMtNDJkMjgzNzJjZTlkXkEyXkFqcGdeQTNwaW5nZXN0._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer 1","datePublished":"2013-10-10","description":"Eight outsiders are trying to create a theater play while breaking every rule of theater craft.","keywords":"theater","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2994904/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"info-480-509704","dateCreated":"2013-12-13","inLanguage":"English","name":"John Wayne is turning in his grave with laughter!","reviewBody":"Rating: 8,5/10 review by Vanja Runjic\n\nThe story of the movie Cowboys is not just a story of good and evil, as the movie heroes identify the main dramatic axis of the western as a genre, but also a story of high art and low populism - although some high-brow film critics would say that is basically the same thing. Cowboys are based on a hit theater show that was seen by well over 100.000 viewers (some say even 150.000), proving that an art experiment need not necessarily be abstract, hermetic and addressed to narrow elitist circles. However, one need not see the theater show to enjoy the movie. In fact, it might be quite refreshing to see it without preconceptions. A gloomy middle-aged theater director Sasha (Sasa Anocic) returns to his home town, even gloomier industrial province, where an old friend, the local mayor (Niksa Butijer) convinces him to put on a theater show with a group of amateurs. A group of weirdoes and bizarre looking types arrives for the audition, none of them having any acting or theater experience whatsoever, and the disillusioned director ends up taking them all. From the first shots we are aware of all the fullmonthy and other underdog clichés, but instead of seeing them as a potential flaw, surprisingly they turn out to be one of the best qualities of this movie. Considering that everything has already been said in film (and music) and it is not easy to be original, especially on such slippery ground as with popular comedy, I have to point out the work of the director and scriptwriter Tomislav Mrsic, acclaimed documentarist, who has managed to use all the character, situational and dramatic clichés in such a way that the viewer doesn't feel annoyed by the fact that they have all been seen. Which is a good feeling! The movie Cowboys is an ensemble comedy, and it's all about the roles they play – even if there were only two or three great actors, it would be a success. Mrsic was lucky in that regard, mostly thanks to the fact that he used the same cast as in the theater show. There is the dumb Domagoj (the incredible Zivko Anocic), who remains a mystery until the end: is he a complete idiot, mentally challenged, or both, or is he just pretending? Then, the friendly gypsy Miodrag (played by the equally great Rakan Rushaidat); the postman Javor, an annoying wannabe actor, busy bee and mama's boy played by Hrvoje Barisic, a pleasant surprise. I can only imagine how irritable he could get if directed by such masters of annoyance like Gervais, Merchant or Larry David, but Mrsic manages to keep him likable. That is the main forte and the charm of this movie – a feel good atmosphere, light humor, discreet pathos, free of any presumptuousness. Not to mention the grand finale. Comedy is a tricky business, especially when it aims to appeal to the masses. Anybody can make some drunken friends laugh, but big audiences are tough, and critics even tougher. Mrsic and Cowboys did it, and the fact that they reached their goal without over psychologizing the characters or overdramatizing and by using a bunch of commonplace devices, makes their triumph even greater","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1027,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7,"duration":"PT1H47M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Seinfeld
programme.desc: U drugoj sezoni "serije o ničemu", popularni trojac, George, Elaine i Kramer, pod vodstvom Jerryja Seinfelda, u 12 novih epizoda obrađuje ozbiljnu problematiku u kojem se društvo nalazi. U drugoj sezoni "serije o ničemu", popularni trojac, George, Elaine i Kramer, pod vodstvom Jerryja Seinfelda, u 12 novih epizoda obrađuje ozbiljnu problematiku u kojem se društvo nalazi. George koji je prekinuo s djevojkom, Jerry, čija je jakna preskupa da bi trpjela padaline, je svojim komentarom dao naslutiti kako je njegova obitelj mrtva, krađa kasete sa govorne sekretarice nakon što George ostavi nekolicinu neprikladnih poruka, Jerryjeva odluka da nosi vjenčani prsten jer će tako lakše upecati komada, osveta, srčani udar, kip tek su neke od tema koje je vesela ekipa pretresla u drugoj sezoni. Jedno znamo, nitko ne može ostati ravnodušan na Seinfelda.

Doggie Boogie
programme.desc: Doggie Boogie - Get Your Grrr On!: Directed by Romanus Wolter. With Jesse Draper, Bettina Devin, Jane Wiedlin, Patrick Alan Davis. A devoted Bichon pup helps his teenage owner and her dog-dancing uncle unleash their potential." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1795588/","name":"Doggie Boogie - Get Your Grrr On!","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTgzMzQ2MTc0NV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwODc0MTExNg@@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"PG","genre":["Family"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1822808/","name":"Jesse Draper"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0222570/","name":"Bettina Devin"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005553/","name":"Jane Wiedlin"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2787860/","name":"Romanus Wolter"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0324071/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2787860/","name":"Romanus Wolter"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Doggie Boogie","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi303343385","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTM4MjgyMjI0MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNTY2OTEwOQ@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTM4MjgyMjI0MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNTY2OTEwOQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for Doggie Boogie"},"datePublished":"2013-04-11","description":"A devoted Bichon pup helps his teenage owner and her dog-dancing uncle unleash their potential.","keywords":"dog,children,disney","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1795588/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"barbara91311"},"dateCreated":"2012-04-14","inLanguage":"English","name":"Fun, fun movie","reviewBody":"This movie is a delightful, fun watch. I laughed, and felt good after seeing it. Loved seeing the audience happy and clapping at the end. The heroine is cute, Pijo, the dog, is adorable, and all the characters are fun to watch. Loved the brightly colored clothes, and dog touches to the movie. I noticed everything was canine related - down to the bone mats on the floor during the yoga scene. I understand that this movie was completely filmed in San Francisco, and used only SAG actors and actresses. And the film was entirely written and directed by the same person. Fun, fun, fun. Do not miss this movie, especially if you have kids - they will love it. It is a pleasure to see something lighthearted and family oriented.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":122,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":3.3},"duration":"PT1H28M"}</script><metacontent="

Deserving Story with or without 3D","reviewBody":"8.5 of 10. Genius kid invents a perpetual motion machine, goes on adventure. Simple but without a well-developed plot and quirky characters like the one Helena Bonham Carter plays (and continues to set her characters apart from every other actor on the planet), this would be heavily dependent on 3D to be worth viewing in theaters.

What starts out as seemingly just a nerd on the ranch family comedy, develops into a more complex tale. Then when it seems to have reduced to a road-trip, self-discovery story, it once again expands and delivers more.

The other key character in this is played by Judy Davis. There are, however, an ongoing stream of brilliant characters to provide fun and suspense in what really shouldn't be promoted as just 3D kid action.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":17436,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.1},"duration":"PT1H45M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Klub otpisanih
programme.desc: Pierce (Chevy Chase) i još nekoliko studenata konzumirali su biološki opasnu tvar na školskoj zabavi povodom Noći vještica, što u njima izazove simptome slične gripi i počne ih pretvarati u zombije. Pierce (Chevy Chase) i još nekoliko studenata konzumirali su biološki opasnu tvar na školskoj zabavi povodom Noći vještica, što u njima izazove simptome slične gripi i počne ih pretvarati u zombije. Ostatak grupe zapalo je da spase sebe i školu nakon što ih je dekan Pelton (Jim Rash) zaključao sa studentskim tijelom zaraženim zombijima. Pridružuje im se Chang. Shvate da snižavanje temperature može ubiti zombi virus. U ulogama se pojavljuju i Joel McHale, Allison Brie, Yvette Nicole Brown, Donald Glover, Danny Pudi, Gillian Jacobs i Ken Jeong.

programme.title: Klub otpisanih
programme.desc: Nakon razredne tuče sa skupinom "opakih cura" predvođenih Meghan (gostujuća zvijezda Hilary Duff), Britta (Gillian Jacobs), Shirley (Yvette Nicole Brown) i Annie (Alison Brie) povezuju se s Abedom. Nakon razredne tuče sa skupinom "opakih cura" predvođenih Meghan (gostujuća zvijezda Hilary Duff), Britta (Gillian Jacobs), Shirley (Yvette Nicole Brown) i Annie (Alison Brie) povezuju se s Abedom (Danny Pudi) te ga pretvore u vrhunsku "opaku curu". U međuvremenu Jeff (Joel McHale) i Troy (Donald Glover) prigrle duhovnost nalik zenu pod vodstvom vrtlara nakon što na kampusu naiđu na tajni trampolin. Odlučan u tome da razotkrije izvor njihova novoga blaženstva, Pierce (Chevy Chase) na kraju u katastrofalnom obratu s trampolina završava u bolnici. U ulozi se pojavljuje i Ken Jeong.

programme.title: Seinfeld
programme.desc: U drugoj sezoni "serije o ničemu", popularni trojac, George, Elaine i Kramer, pod vodstvom Jerryja Seinfelda, u 12 novih epizoda obrađuje ozbiljnu problematiku u kojem se društvo nalazi. U drugoj sezoni "serije o ničemu", popularni trojac, George, Elaine i Kramer, pod vodstvom Jerryja Seinfelda, u 12 novih epizoda obrađuje ozbiljnu problematiku u kojem se društvo nalazi. George koji je prekinuo s djevojkom, Jerry, čija je jakna preskupa da bi trpjela padaline, je svojim komentarom dao naslutiti kako je njegova obitelj mrtva, krađa kasete sa govorne sekretarice nakon što George ostavi nekolicinu neprikladnih poruka, Jerryjeva odluka da nosi vjenčani prsten jer će tako lakše upecati komada, osveta, srčani udar, kip tek su neke od tema koje je vesela ekipa pretresla u drugoj sezoni. Jedno znamo, nitko ne može ostati ravnodušan na Seinfelda.

#1 Post"},"datePublished":"2005-12-14","description":"Will and Jake Grimm are traveling con-artists who encounter a genuine fairy-tale curse which requires true courage instead of their usual bogus exorcisms.","keywords":"germany,fairy tale,black comedy,gothic,surrealism","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0355295/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"perlner"},"dateCreated":"2005-08-29","inLanguage":"English","name":"highly entertaining","reviewBody":"Are you familiar with the Grimm fairy tales? Did you like the way "Shakespeare in Love" explained how Shakespeare might have gotten his ideas for "Romeo and Juliet?" Did you like "Shrek?" Are you a fan of Matt Damon or Heath Ledger? Do you think Monica Bellucci is hot? If your answer to any of the above questions is "yes," and you are willing to suspend disbelief (because boy is this movie inconsistent if you actually think about it) this film will provide an entertaining diversion. It's funny, interesting, exciting, and even a little scary (so don't bring your little children if they get scared easily).

The premise - Matt Damon and Heath Ledger are the Brothers Grimm, famous around French-occupied Germany for driving away demons, though they are, in fact, con artists with fancy gadgets and conspirators for special effects. They use the money they collect for their "services" to finance their operations. The French occupying government catches them and sentences them to death, unless they out-con the conman who is causing little girls to disappear in a town alongside the woods. In this town and the neighboring woods are the inspirations for numerous Grimm fairy tales, including Hansel & Gretel, Rapunzel, and Little Red Riding Hood.

The characters aren't the most deep of film characters, but they are developed enough to be distinctive and convincing. Will Grimm (Matt Damon) is the brains behind the team, with a very realistic desire to protect his brother, even as he harbors a constant anger at him for blowing the only opportunity to save their little sister's life when they were children. Jake (Heath Ledger) is the dreamer, convinced that there is truth in legend, and that with courage and effort, any problem can be solved. Predictably but not boringly, the two of them provide the perfect team to fight what turns out to be a real-life, magical, evil danger.

The special effects aren't the best; some of the cgi creatures move quite jerkily, but when they're good, they work. The sets are beautiful, and fit the Grimm fairy tale world well. The costumes are likewise gorgeous and apt.

If you think about this film enough to ask questions like, "if evil magic was real, how come the brothers are famous instead of having been discredited the first time they pretended to fight off a real evil presence and it continued to haunt people?" then you will be disappointed. However, if you are willing to suspend disbelief, you'll be in for an entertaining summer popcorn treat.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":117353,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.9},"duration":"PT1H58M"}</script><metacontent="

Will and Jake Grimm are traveling con-artists who encounter a genuine fairy-tale curse which requires true courage instead of their usual bogus exorcisms." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0355295/","name":"The Brothers Grimm","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzZiNGUxZmUtYjc0ZC00YzkxLWI2MWMtNDc0MWFiNjc5NGRkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTIzOTk5ODM@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Comedy"],"actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000354/","name":"Matt Damon","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005132/","name":"Heath Ledger","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000899/","name":"Monica Bellucci"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000416/","name":"Terry Gilliam"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0019626/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0007143/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0037759/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0472567/","name":"Ehren Kruger"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Brothers Grimm","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3924341017","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzM2ZDM3MWQtM2EwMi00ODNiLThlMTMtOTFkMjZmNDU4ZWYwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzM2ZDM3MWQtM2EwMi00ODNiLThlMTMtOTFkMjZmNDU4ZWYwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"CT #1 Post","datePublished":"2005-12-14","description":"Will and Jake Grimm are traveling con-artists who encounter a genuine fairy-tale curse which requires true courage instead of their usual bogus exorcisms.","keywords":"germany,fairy tale,black comedy,gothic,surrealism","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0355295/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"perlner","dateCreated":"2005-08-29","inLanguage":"English","name":"highly entertaining","reviewBody":"Are you familiar with the Grimm fairy tales? Did you like the way "Shakespeare in Love" explained how Shakespeare might have gotten his ideas for "Romeo and Juliet?" Did you like "Shrek?" Are you a fan of Matt Damon or Heath Ledger? Do you think Monica Bellucci is hot? If your answer to any of the above questions is "yes," and you are willing to suspend disbelief (because boy is this movie inconsistent if you actually think about it) this film will provide an entertaining diversion. It's funny, interesting, exciting, and even a little scary (so don't bring your little children if they get scared easily).

The premise - Matt Damon and Heath Ledger are the Brothers Grimm, famous around French-occupied Germany for driving away demons, though they are, in fact, con artists with fancy gadgets and conspirators for special effects. They use the money they collect for their "services" to finance their operations. The French occupying government catches them and sentences them to death, unless they out-con the conman who is causing little girls to disappear in a town alongside the woods. In this town and the neighboring woods are the inspirations for numerous Grimm fairy tales, including Hansel & Gretel, Rapunzel, and Little Red Riding Hood.

The characters aren't the most deep of film characters, but they are developed enough to be distinctive and convincing. Will Grimm (Matt Damon) is the brains behind the team, with a very realistic desire to protect his brother, even as he harbors a constant anger at him for blowing the only opportunity to save their little sister's life when they were children. Jake (Heath Ledger) is the dreamer, convinced that there is truth in legend, and that with courage and effort, any problem can be solved. Predictably but not boringly, the two of them provide the perfect team to fight what turns out to be a real-life, magical, evil danger.

The special effects aren't the best; some of the cgi creatures move quite jerkily, but when they're good, they work. The sets are beautiful, and fit the Grimm fairy tale world well. The costumes are likewise gorgeous and apt.

If you think about this film enough to ask questions like, "if evil magic was real, how come the brothers are famous instead of having been discredited the first time they pretended to fight off a real evil presence and it continued to haunt people?" then you will be disappointed. However, if you are willing to suspend disbelief, you'll be in for an entertaining summer popcorn treat.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":117353,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.9,"duration":"PT1H58M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Klub otpisanih
programme.desc: Nakon što Annie (Alison Brie) nestane olovka, ona osumnjiči člana svoje vlastite studijske grupe. Nakon što Annie (Alison Brie) nestane olovka, ona osumnjiči člana svoje vlastite studijske grupe. Pothvativši se zadatka da pronađe olovku i riješi misterij, grupa samu sebe zaključa, a Jeff (Joel McHale) preuzme na sebe vodstvo u pretresu. Annie ne odustaje dok se olovka ne pronađe. U međuvremenu Troya (Donald Glover) i Abeda (Danny Pudi) žulja da napuste kabinet kako bi stigli na Greendalesku paradu štenaca u dvorištu koledža. U ulogama se pojavljuju i Chevy Chase i Gillian Jacobs.

programme.title: Klub otpisanih
programme.desc: Nakon što se studijska grupa okupi da proslavi Troyev (Donald Glover) rođendan, shvate da on zapravo navršava 21 godinu, pa odlučuju krenuti u obilazak barova. Nakon što se studijska grupa okupi da proslavi Troyev (Donald Glover) rođendan, shvate da on zapravo navršava 21 godinu, pa odlučuju krenuti u obilazak barova. I dok Jeff (Joel McHale) i Britta (Gillian Jacobs) popiju koju koktel previše i postanu luckasti, Shirley (Yvette Nicole Brown) se pothvaća skinuti svoje inkriminirajuće fotografije postavljene za točionikom. Annie (Alison Brie) prigrljuje identitet na svojoj lažnoj osobnoj iskaznici, dok se Abed (Danny Pudi) upušta u razgovor s kolegom šmokljanom i poklonikom znanstvene fantastike. U ulozi se pojavljuje i Chevy Chase.

programme.title: Conversations with Other Women
Razgovori s drugim ženama
programme.desc: Conversations with Other Women: Directed by Hans Canosa. With Aaron Eckhart, Helena Bonham Carter, Yury Tsykun, Brian Geraghty. When a man and woman flirt with each other at a wedding reception, the sexual tension seems spontaneous. As they break from the party to a hotel room, the flirtation turns into a night filled with passion and remorse." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0435623/","name":"Conversations with Other Women","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTg1NjIyNzc3M15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMTE3NjUzMQ@@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Romance"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000307/","name":"Helena Bonham Carter"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001173/","name":"Aaron Eckhart"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1541751/","name":"Yury Tsykun"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0134396/","name":"Hans Canosa"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0137407/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0045159/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0955251/","name":"Gabrielle Zevin"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Conversations With Other Women","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1790902553","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjQ3Zjc1YzgtYTAyNC00NzBlLTg4MjctYWI0ZjQ1ZjJjYmIzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjQ3Zjc1YzgtYTAyNC00NzBlLTg4MjctYWI0ZjQ1ZjJjYmIzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Canalplus"},"datePublished":"2007-05-18","description":"When a man and woman flirt with each other at a wedding reception, the sexual tension seems spontaneous. As they break from the party to a hotel room, the flirtation turns into a night filled with passion and remorse.","keywords":"split screen,bittersweet,duo vision,two hander,sex comedy","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0435623/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"rayofsun"},"dateCreated":"2005-09-20","inLanguage":"English","name":"Dual screen character piece brilliantly played by Helena Bonham Carter and Aaron Eckhart","reviewBody":"This film is a bit different than most because is filmed for dual screen, meaning that during every scene there are 2 cameras capturing the action. Usually we are shown the same event from different angles, other times the 2 sides are splits in time, so we see the past and present. The main characters, played brilliantly by Helena Bonham Carter and Aaron Eckhart, meet as participants in a wedding and rediscover their past. The dialog is brilliantly written and the acting superb. In the question and answer session after the screening, Ms. Carter was asked if the split screen made acting more difficult. She replied that unlike the shooting of a "normal" movie where they would have to shoot each person's part separately then take a break and move the camera and do the other person, with both camera's running at the same time, the whole scene could be shot nearly continuously allowing for a more realistic conversation situation. This made things much easier, but she did admit she missed having any "down time" since she was always in front of one of the cameras.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":12184,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7},"duration":"PT1H24M"}</script><metacontent="

The screenplay is witty and distinct (with some predictability though) and all the cast is good (supporting actors) or excellent (leading actors Brian Cox and Paul Dano). They are masterly both together and separately, you constantly feel chemistry between them - does not matter if their characters agree or disagree.\n\nHighly recommended, although the film is not to everybody's taste: most of event occur in a bar, scenes including women are infrequent, the ending is ambivalent. But still, this film deserves far more attention, praise and distribution, primarily in northern parts of Europe and America.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":4414,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.9},"duration":"PT1H39M"}</script><metacontent="

They are masterly both together and separately, you constantly feel chemistry between them - does not matter if their characters agree or disagree.\n\nHighly recommended, although the film is not to everybody's taste: most of event occur in a bar, scenes including women are infrequent, the ending is ambivalent. programme.title: The Fifth Estate
Tajne petog staleža
programme.desc:
The Fifth Estate: Directed by Bill Condon. With Peter Capaldi, David Thewlis, Anatole Taubman, Alexander Beyer. A dramatic thriller based on real events that reveals the quest to expose the deceptions and corruptions of power that turned an Internet upstart into the 21st century's most fiercely debated organization." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1837703/","name":"The Fifth Estate","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjY1MTY5NTg3M15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDQyMjgwMDE@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"R","genre":["Biography","Crime","Drama"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1212722/","name":"Benedict Cumberbatch"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0117709/","name":"Daniel Brühl"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0396924/","name":"Carice van Houten"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0174374/","name":"Bill Condon"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0819670/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0336601/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0132772/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4240689/","name":"Daniel Domscheit-Berg"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3859582/","name":"David Leigh"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4816469/","name":"Luke Harding"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer #1","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2566236441","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTkyMDI2OTEyMF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMzY3OTc4OQ@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTkyMDI2OTEyMF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMzY3OTc4OQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A dramatic thriller based on real events that reveals the quest to expose the deceptions and corruptions of power that turned an Internet upstart into the 21st centuryÂ’s most fiercely debated organization.
"},"datePublished":"2013-10-18","description":"A dramatic thriller based on real events that reveals the quest to expose the deceptions and corruptions of power that turned an Internet upstart into the 21st century's most fiercely debated organization.","keywords":"internet,pantyhose,red pantyhose,female stockinged legs,female stockinged feet","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1837703/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"muthink"},"dateCreated":"2013-11-08","inLanguage":"English","name":"Benedict Cumberbatch only plays villains","reviewBody":"As I walked into the theater with my wife, she asked me again what this film was about. I said, its about Wikileaks. I told her about Assange and the mission of Wikileaks. I had already had my own formed opinions about Assange, but refrained from sharing it with her. I was curious to see what her reaction was and what her opinion of Wikileaks and Assange was after the film.

The film was not bad. It was sort of an attempt to make a Facebook style film about Wikileaks and although it nowhere measured up to the quality of "Social Network." Its attempt was commendable and all-in-all, it was not a waste of the 18 Euros we spent to see it.

However, what really bothered me throughout the entire film was Cumberbatch's portrayal of Assange. I could see he was trying very hard to mimic Assange to the best of his ability, but I either don't think he had it in him or he was purposely playing Assange a lot crazier than he appears in real life. I have seen lots of interviews with Assange, who in my mind, comes across a bit like a mixture between a politician and professor. Cumberbatch, on the other hand, came across as a sort of eccentric nut.

The next thing that bothered me is where the film decided to stop. Basically, it skimmed over the current scandals, making Assange sound like more of nut than Cumberbatch's portrayal. The last five minutes especially sunk into me the feeling that the film unfairly portrayed Assange.

And my suspicions were confirmed. I asked my wife what her opinion of Assange was as a good or bad guy, and she seemed to indicate she was leaning towards bad. The last few minutes of the film, basically sunk that message in loud and clear.

My conclusion is, that, this film is a good example of the new way of being critical. Pretend to be fair and at the last minute, throw up a bunch of negative facts.

I believe that combining the positive portrayal of the U.S. state department with the crazy portrayal of Assange, was neither fair nor accurate. History will probably judge this film as just another propaganda piece of the corrupt powers that be.

If I were to write this film, I think it would have been much more interesting to concentrate on the incidents of human rights abuses rather than on the Assange himself. It would have also had the positive effect of encouraging, rather than discouraging whistle-blowers. This film does not seem to inspire anything.

Assange was right about the film.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":39462,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.2},"duration":"PT2H8M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Sapphires
Sapphires
programme.desc:
The Sapphires: Directed by Wayne Blair. With Tanika Lonesborough, Nioka Brennan, Lynette Narkle, Kylie Belling. It's 1968, and four young, talented Australian Aboriginal girls learn about love, friendship and war when their all-girl group The Sapphires entertain the US troops in Vietnam." 1968, and four young, talented Australian Aboriginal girls learn about love, friendship and war when their all girl group The Sapphires entertain the US troops in Vietnam."},"datePublished":"2012-08-09","description":"It's 1968, and four young, talented Australian Aboriginal girls learn about love, friendship and war when their all-girl group The Sapphires entertain the US troops in Vietnam.","keywords":"vietnam war,1960s,aboriginal,soul music,lead singer","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1673697/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"mroodge"},"dateCreated":"2012-07-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"Enjoyable and uniquely Australian","reviewBody":"First and foremost, it's important to say that this is a drama, and the comedy and music are secondary. An enormous relief, in a film that needed to tell a story, and not turn the experiences of the four girls, and their manager, in to a musical.

'The Sapphires' tells a uniquely Australian story of four Aboriginal girls who overcame the prejudice of the 60s to find themselves sent off to Vietnam to entertain the troops, along with their charismatic, but occasionally inept, manager (Chris O'Dowd). There's a decent ensemble cast, with exceptional performances from Deborah Mailman and Shari Sebbens.

The film is uplifting, gently deals with some big issues that faced Aborigines and is entertaining to just about anyone. Some criticism of the film was that it underplayed both the Vietnam War itself, and a couple of related events (easily spotted in the film), however I disagree. The film was busy drawing together the strands of storyline concerning the girls. To have emphasised any further the war, or any particular event, could only have detracted from the audience's appreciation of the other characters.

Highly recommended for just about anyone. Non-Australians will be introduced to a little of Aboriginal culture and their struggle for equality, as well as a ripper movie that's fun and funny; Australians will be glad to see a rare story of Aboriginal triumph in the 20th century.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":13747,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7},"duration":"PT1H43M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.desc:
The Bank Job: Directed by Roger Donaldson. With Jason Statham, Saffron Burrows, Stephen Campbell Moore, Daniel Mays. Martine offers Terry a lead on a foolproof bank hit on London's Baker Street. She targets a roomful of safe deposit boxes worth millions in cash and jewelry along with a treasure trove of dirty secrets." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0200465/","name":"The Bank Job","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmE2NzEyOWItYjI1ZC00YWZhLWI2MjEtZmU1NjIyNjliOTkyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTYzMDM0NTU@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"R","genre":["Crime","Drama","Thriller"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005458/","name":"Jason Statham"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004787/","name":"Saffron Burrows"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1304386/","name":"Stephen Campbell Moore"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0002044/","name":"Roger Donaldson"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0037759/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0142678/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0239107/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0166074/","name":"Dick Clement"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0478588/","name":"Ian La Frenais"}],"datePublished":"2009-01-28","description":"Martine offers Terry a lead on a foolproof bank hit on London's Baker Street. She targets a roomful of safe deposit boxes worth millions in cash and jewelry along with a treasure trove of dirty secrets.","keywords":"safe deposit,heist,chase,mobster,london england","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0200465/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ccthemovieman-1"},"dateCreated":"2008-08-14","inLanguage":"English","name":"Heist Films Are Usually Entertaining, And This Is No Exception","reviewBody":"Jason Statham is well on his way to becoming typecast. It seems like he's in a ton of these kind of action films lately, although this movie is a bit more subdued and complicated than some of them. At least in this heist flick, there are several twists and turns and you have to stay alert to follow who is exactly on the up-and-up and who isn't, and Statham isn't punching out 10 people at once.

This is another one of these modern-day films in which the crooks, the thieves, the bandits - whatever - are the "good guys" and the police and the government officials are the bad guys. This seems to be a big favorite of the anti-authority filmmakers world in the last 40 years whether it's in Hollywood or London. Regardless, it's a very entertaining film and Statham and company are fun to watch. That's also nothing new as the tough "Transporter" star has become a regular at playing these kind of nice guy/macho/thug roles.

Statham plays "Terry Leather," a man recruited by a former hottie/model girlfriend "Martine Love," (Saffron Burrows) to rob a bank. Statham is a family man but desperate for money and, obviously, not very honest. Thousands of pounds/dollars is in it for the thieves but valuable compromising sex photos are the real goal of the people who want the bank depository drawers robbed. Those want to be grabbed before the owner uses them and ruins some high uppity-ups in British government. Several people wants photos for other reasons. This whole thing isn't simple; there are number of sub-plots along the way regarding who wants what in the bank and for what reasons. 

There is also a story involving a Malcolm X-wannabe kind of creep who is into extortion and murder. Actually, everyone is pretty much a creep in this film, just to varying degrees. They are all interesting, too, and several of the minor characters have a good sense of humor, too. In particular, I liked Daniel Mays as "Dave Shilling." Add some very tense robbery scenes, some sex early on, some double-crosses later and you have a very serious Keystone Cops type story where you're never quite sure what crazy thing is going to happen next.

A fun two hours of diversion, supposedly based on a true-life account, but knowing filmmakers I suspect much of this is made up for dramatic purposes. That's okay, we just watch to be entertained, and this is entertaining.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":175555,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.2},"duration":"PT1H51M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Adaptation
Adaptacija
programme.desc:
Adaptation.: Directed by Spike Jonze. With Nicolas Cage, Tilda Swinton, Meryl Streep, Chris Cooper. A lovelorn screenwriter becomes desperate as he tries and fails to adapt 'The Orchid Thief' by Susan Orlean for the screen." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0268126/","name":"Adaptation.","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjIwZWU0ZDItNzBlNS00MDIwLWFlZjctZTJjODdjZWYxNzczL2ltYWdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTMxODk2OTU@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Drama"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000115/","name":"Nicolas Cage"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000658/","name":"Meryl Streep"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0177933/","name":"Chris Cooper"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005069/","name":"Spike Jonze"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0058058/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0093046/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0007554/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0650036/","name":"Susan Orlean"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0442109/","name":"Charlie Kaufman"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Adaptation.","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1706934041","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNWZlNjBhNjUtN2QwZS00YWIyLTg0ZWUtNWFmMWRmMzBjYmJjXkEyXkFqcGdeQTNwaW5nZXN0._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNWZlNjBhNjUtN2QwZS00YWIyLTg0ZWUtNWFmMWRmMzBjYmJjXkEyXkFqcGdeQTNwaW5nZXN0._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer 2"},"datePublished":"2003-02-14","description":"A lovelorn screenwriter becomes desperate as he tries and fails to adapt 'The Orchid Thief' by Susan Orlean for the screen.","keywords":"loneliness,thief,twin,writing,magical realism","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0268126/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"krispatmo"},"dateCreated":"2003-03-15","inLanguage":"English","name":"Could you be more Original?","reviewBody":"Incredible.

Charlie Kaufman might just be the most genius screenwriter (I daren't say ever) at the moment. I mean, trying to adapt a book for a screenplay, not succeeding, yet in the process writing a screenplay about how you can't seem to adapt this book for a screenplay. Oh yeah, and also being helped by your not existing twin brother, and crediting him as co-writer, and being nominatad for an Oscar together with him.

Is anyone following this?

Kaufman seems to be the master of destroying the line between reality and fiction.

I kind of have a hard time saying anything about this movie, because I don't know what to say. You should just go and say it. There's nothing like it.

If you liked Being John Malkovic you wil definitely love this. If you hated BJM you might still like it. It doesn't have the absurdity and surreality of BJM. The story is just incredibly intelligently written.

Even though the movie is about how Kaufman is unable to adapt this book, he actually succeeds in doing just that in the process.

Jesus, I'm still totally stunned.

Jonze does do a very good job once again. But the direction is just outshined by the story...","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":181886,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.7},"duration":"PT1H55M"}</script><metacontent="

that knocks you out of your seat","reviewBody":"First of all, i must say - amazing. Al Pacino is still at his best. A lot of women actress and those crazy 88 minutes for Pacino. If you want to see a lot of shooting - don't expect that. 3 shots through all movie is all you will see. 88 Minutes is a must see for all thrillers fans. Not a movie for a dull housewife, because it holds your breath until 88 minute and then bang. You must see. Its something similar to "Unknown", but less mysterious and more unpredictable. Thats one of those movies, then you expect nothing, and get everything. In some point of a movie i even thought that i see the same young don from the godfather, running and entertaining us as always. So, sit back, relax, and then join Pacino in solving his own murder. 1968, and four young, talented Australian Aboriginal girls learn about love, friendship and war when their all girl group The Sapphires entertain the US troops in Vietnam."},"datePublished":"2012-08-09","description":"It's 1968, and four young, talented Australian Aboriginal girls learn about love, friendship and war when their all-girl group The Sapphires entertain the US troops in Vietnam.","keywords":"vietnam war,1960s,aboriginal,soul music,lead singer","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1673697/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"mroodge"},"dateCreated":"2012-07-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"Enjoyable and uniquely Australian","reviewBody":"First and foremost, it's important to say that this is a drama, and the comedy and music are secondary. An enormous relief, in a film that needed to tell a story, and not turn the experiences of the four girls, and their manager, in to a musical.

'The Sapphires' tells a uniquely Australian story of four Aboriginal girls who overcame the prejudice of the 60s to find themselves sent off to Vietnam to entertain the troops, along with their charismatic, but occasionally inept, manager (Chris O'Dowd). There's a decent ensemble cast, with exceptional performances from Deborah Mailman and Shari Sebbens.

The film is uplifting, gently deals with some big issues that faced Aborigines and is entertaining to just about anyone. Some criticism of the film was that it underplayed both the Vietnam War itself, and a couple of related events (easily spotted in the film), however I disagree. The film was busy drawing together the strands of storyline concerning the girls. To have emphasised any further the war, or any particular event, could only have detracted from the audience's appreciation of the other characters.

Highly recommended for just about anyone. Non-Australians will be introduced to a little of Aboriginal culture and their struggle for equality, as well as a ripper movie that's fun and funny; Australians will be glad to see a rare story of Aboriginal triumph in the 20th century.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":13747,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7},"duration":"PT1H43M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.desc:
Alatriste: Directed by Agustín Díaz Yanes. With Viggo Mortensen, Elena Anaya, Unax Ugalde, Eduard Fernández. Mortensen plays the Spanish soldier-turned-mercenary Captain Alatriste, a heroic figure from the country's 17th century imperial wars.","keywords":"character name as title,surname as title,man wears eyeglasses,period drama,desire","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0395119/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"westofcordoba"},"dateCreated":"2006-09-10","inLanguage":"English","name":"Intrigue, love and loyalty: a big-budget portrait of a 17th century Spanish mercenary","reviewBody":"It's big-budget, it boasts extras by the planeload, and a broad historical panorama: it's all about intrigue, loyalty, love, and loads of a real man doing what a real man's gotta do. This is the Spanish film industry's most serious attempt yet to break into the mainstream international market, and Viggo Mortensen's brooding, laconic Alatriste makes a convincing bid for the job. A heroic figure despite himself, Alatriste is the poor bloody footsoldier whose unquestioning courage provided the flesh and blood foundations of the Siglo de Oro, the golden age of the early 17th Century when the Spanish crown laid claim to half of western Europe.

In scuffed boots and floppy fedora, Mortensen cuts an attractive figure in an amoral, down-at-heel sort of way: women are prepared to leave their husbands for him, men fight for the privilege of dying at his side. We are led, or perhaps bullied, on an epic sweep through the muck and bullets of Spain's military meddling in its neighbours' affairs, seen through the jaundiced eyes of Alatriste and his fellow hired hands. Death is a constant presence; if you're not torn apart by a cannonball on the battlefield, or knifed in a dark alley, it may well come for you in the shape of the Inquisition  and in which case, you might be better off cutting your own throat.

We cut frantically and frequently back to the Spanish court, where the grandees plot and connive, and we just know that someone inconvenient is about to get dispatched to the colonies at the very least. Here, Alatriste's glint-eyed soldier's determination gives way to the quizzical gaze of a hard man out of his depth, as matters of State are signed and sealed on oaken desks. Watch your back -- you get the impression that the most blood-sodden battlefield is a far safer place to be.

The film covers a massive swathe of turbulent European history, some three decades of a long Spanish Catholic struggle against the Protestant heretics of the Low Countries. And this, perhaps, is the film's greatest flaw  the screenplay is a pull-together of some of the most dramatic episodes from a clutch of Arturo Pérez-Reverte's Captain Alatriste books, and the joins show badly. Sub-plots come and go in a tangle, and the film develops its undoubted dynamism from a regular dripfeed of another bit of swashbuckling, or whispered courtly dirty deeds, rather than the convincing development of any interplay between the characters themselves. For such a valiant warrior, poor Alatriste doesn't seem to have much say in his destiny.

That said, the film looks fabulous, from the opening misty waterlogged shots off the Flanders coast, to the final crunching battle of Rocroi. Director of Photography Paco Femenia -- responsible for the similarly atmospheric Carmen and Juana la Loca -- takes his inspiration from the contemporary canvases of Velásquez to evoke an atmosphere painted in rich earthy tones; the camera conveys the glittering sterility of the Spanish court as tangibly as the dirt that Alatriste and his ever-dwindling band of chums are forced to eat  so often without pay -- to enable their lordships to live in the appropriate style.

The film, at two hours and 20 minutes, rattles along well, but is too long. If only director Augustín Díaz Yanes had the faith in the attraction and bankability of his lead character to take a deep breath, and slice the action up into more manageable chunks: a trilogy, even. Why not? Everybody else seems to be doing it, and so often with inferior material to this.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":12614,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.1},"duration":"PT2H25M"}</script><metacontent="

Adaptacija
programme.desc:
Adaptation.: Directed by Spike Jonze. With Nicolas Cage, Tilda Swinton, Meryl Streep, Chris Cooper. A lovelorn screenwriter becomes desperate as he tries and fails to adapt 'The Orchid Thief' by Susan Orlean for the screen." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0268126/","name":"Adaptation.","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjIwZWU0ZDItNzBlNS00MDIwLWFlZjctZTJjODdjZWYxNzczL2ltYWdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTMxODk2OTU@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Drama"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000115/","name":"Nicolas Cage"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000658/","name":"Meryl Streep"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0177933/","name":"Chris Cooper"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005069/","name":"Spike Jonze"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0058058/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0093046/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0007554/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0650036/","name":"Susan Orlean"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0442109/","name":"Charlie Kaufman"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Adaptation.","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1706934041","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNWZlNjBhNjUtN2QwZS00YWIyLTg0ZWUtNWFmMWRmMzBjYmJjXkEyXkFqcGdeQTNwaW5nZXN0._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNWZlNjBhNjUtN2QwZS00YWIyLTg0ZWUtNWFmMWRmMzBjYmJjXkEyXkFqcGdeQTNwaW5nZXN0._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer 2"},"datePublished":"2003-02-14","description":"A lovelorn screenwriter becomes desperate as he tries and fails to adapt 'The Orchid Thief' by Susan Orlean for the screen.","keywords":"loneliness,thief,twin,writing,magical realism","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0268126/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"krispatmo"},"dateCreated":"2003-03-15","inLanguage":"English","name":"Could you be more Original?","reviewBody":"Incredible.

Charlie Kaufman might just be the most genius screenwriter (I daren't say ever) at the moment. I mean, trying to adapt a book for a screenplay, not succeeding, yet in the process writing a screenplay about how you can't seem to adapt this book for a screenplay. Oh yeah, and also being helped by your not existing twin brother, and crediting him as co-writer, and being nominatad for an Oscar together with him.

Is anyone following this?

Kaufman seems to be the master of destroying the line between reality and fiction.

I kind of have a hard time saying anything about this movie, because I don't know what to say. You should just go and say it. There's nothing like it.

If you liked Being John Malkovic you wil definitely love this. If you hated BJM you might still like it. It doesn't have the absurdity and surreality of BJM. The story is just incredibly intelligently written.

Even though the movie is about how Kaufman is unable to adapt this book, he actually succeeds in doing just that in the process.

Jesus, I'm still totally stunned.

Jonze does do a very good job once again. But the direction is just outshined by the story...","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":181886,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.7},"duration":"PT1H55M"}</script><metacontent="

Cosmopolis
programme.desc: Cosmopolis: Directed by David Cronenberg. With Robert Pattinson, Sarah Gadon, Paul Giamatti, Kevin Durand. Riding across Manhattan in a stretch limo in order to get a haircut, a 28-year-old billionaire asset manager's day devolves into an odyssey with a cast of characters that start to tear his world apart." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1480656/","name":"Cosmopolis","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTY1NjI0MDYyNV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNDIzMDEyOA@@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"R","genre":["Crime","Drama","Fantasy"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1500155/","name":"Robert Pattinson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000300/","name":"Juliette Binoche"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0300589/","name":"Sarah Gadon"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000343/","name":"David Cronenberg"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0238603/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0138248/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0664859/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000343/","name":"David Cronenberg"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1680347/","name":"Don DeLillo"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"No. 2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi127313177","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTc0MzkyMzE3Nl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMTQ5MzIxOA@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTc0MzkyMzE3Nl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMTQ5MzIxOA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Riding across Manhattan in a stretch limo in order to get a haircut, a 28-year-old billionaire asset manager's day devolves into an odyssey with a cast of characters that start to tear his world apart. "},"datePublished":"2012-05-25","description":"Riding across Manhattan in a stretch limo in order to get a haircut, a 28-year-old billionaire asset manager's day devolves into an odyssey with a cast of characters that start to tear his world apart.","keywords":"bare breasts,female buttocks,road movie,bare butt,sex in hotel","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1480656/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"nm6369641"},"dateCreated":"2015-10-26","inLanguage":"English","name":"Bad reviews due to wrong target audience, marketing.","reviewBody":"Cronenberg's Cosmopolis is an adaptation of Don DeLillo's novel. The Novel is accepted as unfilmable an as one of the few novels which composes a precise image of our zeitgeist. The movie is not just based on Cronenberg's clever written script that could be a marvellous play for theatres but also a well directed movie with a talented cast and gets the audience into the atmosphere of a Japanese surreal anime. Nonetheless the movie is a marketing mistake of its kind. The negative reviews that emphasis the main actor Robert Pattinson's ex-sanguine performance are not to understand, since he is exactly as vampire as his character Eric Packer, a 28 years old egoist with a lot of money. However the reason of the box-office flop can be understood. First reason is the difference of target groups: It is possible that neither real Cronenberg fans (because of the poster of Pattinson on the foreground) nor Pattinson fans (since it's not a teenage movie) had the intention to see the movie. Second reason is he wrong advertisement: The audience watches an action trailer but finds out it is a Japanese surreal anime. This masterpiece of art proves us that even sci-fi legend David Cronenberg can flop on box-office.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":45352,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.1},"duration":"PT1H49M"}</script><metacontent="

Nonetheless the movie is a marketing mistake of its kind. The negative reviews that emphasis the main actor Robert Pattinson's ex-sanguine performance are not to understand, since he is exactly as vampire as his character Eric Packer, a 28 years old egoist with a lot of money. However the reason of the box-office flop can be understood. First reason is the difference of target groups: It is possible that neither real Cronenberg fans (because of the poster of Pattinson on the foreground) nor Pattinson fans (since it's not a teenage movie) had the intention to see the movie. Second reason is he wrong advertisement: The audience watches an action trailer but finds out it is a Japanese surreal anime. This masterpiece of art proves us that even sci-fi legend David Cronenberg can flop on box-office.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":45352,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.1,"duration":"PT1H49M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Rudderless
Rudderless
programme.desc:
Rudderless: Directed by William H. Macy. With Miles Heizer, Aly Lovelace, Billy Crudup, Casey Twenter. A grieving father in a downward spiral stumbles across a box of his recently deceased son's demo tapes and lyrics. Shocked by the discovery of this unknown talent, he forms a band in the hope of finding some catharsis." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1798243/","name":"Rudderless","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjQwNTI2MTA0NV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwODc1NzkzMjE@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Music"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001082/","name":"Billy Crudup"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0947338/","name":"Anton Yelchin"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005031/","name":"Felicity Huffman"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000513/","name":"William H. Macy"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0136920/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0290582/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0425435/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3722800/","name":"Casey Twenter"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5369674/","name":"Jeff Robison"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000513/","name":"William H. Macy"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Rudderless","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3805460505","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMGM4ZGYxOTYtZDMzMS00MzRiLTgxNTEtMTU1MDM2MzQ2YzJjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMGM4ZGYxOTYtZDMzMS00MzRiLTgxNTEtMTU1MDM2MzQ2YzJjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for Rudderless"},"datePublished":"2015-02-21","description":"A grieving father in a downward spiral stumbles across a box of his recently deceased son's demo tapes and lyrics. Shocked by the discovery of this unknown talent, he forms a band in the hope of finding some catharsis.","keywords":"intergenerational friendship,school shooting,loss of child,loss of a son,loss of a child","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1798243/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"richard-1967"},"dateCreated":"2014-10-05","inLanguage":"English","name":"Great movie, great music, forgettable title","reviewBody":"We saw this film today at our movie preview club. Wow! Best film I've seen so far this year (although the big guns have yet to come out). The only problem with it is I can't for the life of me remember the film's name in order to tell my friends to go see it.

It's not easy writing and directing an original movie that has a new slant on a familiar topic - a tragic mass murder at a school in which the main character's son dies. To do it poignantly and lovingly, and add in some really terrific music, is to accomplish a great deal indeed.

There's a lot to like here. Billy Crudup, in virtually every scene, shows his depth as an actor as he tries to come to terms with his cataclysmic loss. The music that Crudup's character discovers is well beyond good, and it's used effectively to move the story along and just plain listen to. The band members who help play the music add exuberance, the anxiety of youth, and humor. One great moment: When the band plays the children's song "The Wheels on the Bus."

Macy proves to be an excellent story-teller. Not much back story about any character, but none is needed, because this film takes place in an ever-evolving present. And - without saying a word about what it is - Macy does the most difficult thing to do in a film: he nails the ending. I'm ready to go see it again.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":18005,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.5},"duration":"PT1H45M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.desc: Directed by Jason Hall. With Miles Teller, Beulah Koale, Joe Cole, Scott Haze. A group of U.S. soldiers returning from Iraq struggle to integrate back into family and civilian life, while living with the memory of a war that threatens to destroy them long after they've left the battlefield.

Wilson"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Wild Wild West","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2952593689","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDI4YzM0M2EtMTZjMy00ZTAwLWJmNDMtM2Y5YWFjNjU2ZmM2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDI4YzM0M2EtMTZjMy00ZTAwLWJmNDMtM2Y5YWFjNjU2ZmM2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer"},"datePublished":"1999-06-30","description":"The two best special agents in the Wild West must save President Grant from the clutches of a diabolical, wheelchair-bound, steampunk-savvy, Confederate scientist bent on revenge for losing the Civil War.","keywords":"utah,buddy movie,steampunk,george washington character,ulysses s. grant character","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0120891/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"twassel"},"dateCreated":"2000-01-18","inLanguage":"English","name":"Pretty awful","reviewBody":"The fun old TV series becomes a tired series of special-effects scenes. Will Smith tries, but is miscast and utterly unbelievable. (And I'm sorry, but having an African-American as a "top government agent" four years after the end of the Civil War simply cannot be made believable, despite valiant attempts to try.) Kevin Kline, a fine actor, does what he can as Artemus Gordon, but seems to be recapitulating his "In and Out" persona (Ross Martin was never that prissy.) Kenneth Branagh, as the villain, plays it so far over the top you can't even see the top from where he his. Salma Hayek is undeniably lovely, but is wasted (she's basically an afterthought). Special effects are good, plot is stupid, script is awful. As a fan of the old series, I was very disappointed.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":4}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":154730,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.9},"duration":"PT1H46M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Revengers
Osvetnici Kolorada
programme.desc:
The Revengers: Directed by Daniel Mann. With William Holden, Ernest Borgnine, Woody Strode, Roger Hanin. When a rancher's family is massacred by a gang of outlaws, he assembles a mean team of convicts as his posse to pursue the killers." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0069179/","name":"The Revengers","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzg2MWZmNWItZTFhMS00ZDJjLThkNjAtYjcwY2I2Mzg2M2NiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjI4MjA5MzA@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"PG","genre":["Western"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000034/","name":"William Holden"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000308/","name":"Ernest Borgnine"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0834754/","name":"Woody Strode"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0542702/","name":"Daniel Mann"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0114899/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0091365/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0562606/","name":"Wendell Mayes"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0135830/","name":"Steven W. Carabatsos"}],"datePublished":"1973-04-19","description":"When a rancher's family is massacred by a gang of outlaws, he assembles a mean team of convicts as his posse to pursue the killers.","keywords":"male male relationship,bare chested male,hairy chest,vindication,gang","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0069179/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"bkoganbing"},"dateCreated":"2010-08-20","inLanguage":"English","name":"Bill's Dirty Half A Dozen","reviewBody":"The Revengers, a western that is a combination of The Searchers and The Dirty Dozen is known primarily for being Susan Hayward's farewell big screen performance. And it gives her a reunion with William Holden who co-starred in 1940 with her in Those Were The Days back when they were both young Paramount contract players.

Holden plays a rancher with a nice family whose home is attacked by the Comanches who were riding with some white men as well. It's those white Comancheros that Holden is after. But he can hardly take them alone. What he does is go to a Mexican prison that rents out convict labor and hires six of them. His dirty half a dozen are Ernest Borgnine, Woody Strode, Jorge Luke, Roger Hanin, Reinhard Kolldehoff, and Jorge Martinez DeHoyos.

Of course the highlight of the film are Holden's scenes with Hayward who plays a nurse practitioner in a frontier town who treats Holden after he's been shot. The two of them have such an easy chemistry they are a pleasure to watch. Hayward would make one more made for television film after The Revengers.

The final battle scene with the Holden group and some cavalry against the Comanches is nicely staged. Action fans should be pleased with The Revengers and the attraction of Susan Hayward is always welcome.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1002,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.1},"duration":"PT1H46M"}</script><metacontent="

Carabatsos"],"datePublished":"1973-04-19","description":"When a rancher's family is massacred by a gang of outlaws, he assembles a mean team of convicts as his posse to pursue the killers.","keywords":"male male relationship,bare chested male,hairy chest,vindication,gang","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0069179/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"bkoganbing","dateCreated":"2010-08-20","inLanguage":"English","name":"Bill's Dirty Half A Dozen","reviewBody":"The Revengers, a western that is a combination of The Searchers and The Dirty Dozen is known primarily for being Susan Hayward's farewell big screen performance. And it gives her a reunion with William Holden who co-starred in 1940 with her in Those Were The Days back when they were both young Paramount contract players.

Holden plays a rancher with a nice family whose home is attacked by the Comanches who were riding with some white men as well. It's those white Comancheros that Holden is after. But he can hardly take them alone. What he does is go to a Mexican prison that rents out convict labor and hires six of them. His dirty half a dozen are Ernest Borgnine, Woody Strode, Jorge Luke, Roger Hanin, Reinhard Kolldehoff, and Jorge Martinez DeHoyos.

Of course the highlight of the film are Holden's scenes with Hayward who plays a nurse practitioner in a frontier town who treats Holden after he's been shot. The two of them have such an easy chemistry they are a pleasure to watch. Hayward would make one more made for television film after The Revengers.

The final battle scene with the Holden group and some cavalry against the Comanches is nicely staged. Action fans should be pleased with The Revengers and the attraction of Susan Hayward is always welcome.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1002,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.1,"duration":"PT1H46M"</script><metacontent="

for this western revenge tale"},"datePublished":"1958-08-01","description":"A man is chasing four outlaws who killed his wife and finds them in a small town's jail, but they escape to Mexico.","keywords":"revenge,rape,outlaw gang,chase,based on novel","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0051433/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"adrian-43767"},"dateCreated":"2018-08-09","inLanguage":"English","name":"Peck at his best in good Western that raises moral questions","reviewBody":"This is an interesting Western which, as is often the case in this genre, is a tale of revenge. This time, however, there are a few ironical twists. Under the solid hand of director Henry King, this film takes further the point made in OXBOW INCIDENT in 1943, about lynching.

In this case, you have the main character, Jim Douglas (Peck) seeking revenge for the rape and brutal murder of his wife. Peck, in one of his finest performances, portrays a generally balanced and good man driven somewhat over the edge by a desire for revenge. The four "baddies" are all played with considerable zest by Stephen Boyd, Henry Silva, Lee van Cleef and Salmi. The weakest part of the film is Joan Collins. Tough for me to understand why and how she got this role.

Silva, portraying an Indian, correctly identifies Douglas as a hunter. It is Douglas' sad failing that he gets the wrong culprits, and even more so that he thought the real rapist and murderer a good man, who would not hurt anyone.

Douglas ends the film with a tormented conscience for killing three men who were innocent of his charges, but he receives great applause from the local community, grateful to see the town rid of a gang of thieves. The irony of the situation is put across without any moralizing, which adds to the film's virtues.

There are a few unnecessary touches along the way, such as Boyd raping an abductee, but by and large it is a tightly told story, helped by very good cinematography.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":5087,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7},"duration":"PT1H38M"}</script><metacontent="
